meanings.definition: A person who constantly expresses dissatisfaction or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The complainers in the office always find something to be unhappy about.
meanings.sent2: My sister is one of the biggest complainers I know; she complains about everything.
meanings.sent3: The group of complainers at the meeting made everyone laugh with their constant grumbling.
meanings.sent4: The complainers in the neighborhood were like broken records, always whining about the same things.
meanings.sent5: The image of the complainers with frowns on their faces is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: Those who habitually grumble or protest.
meanings.sent1: During the protest, the complainers voiced their dissatisfaction with the new policy.
meanings.sent2: The complainers at the town hall meeting were loud and persistent in their objections.
meanings.sent3: The group of complainers outside City Hall held up signs with funny slogans.
meanings.sent4: The complainers in the park sounded like a chorus of discontent, echoing through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The image of the complainers waving their banners is still vivid in my mind.
